Action: ## Test Admin Application Search Display
Go to the DOAJ admin application search at /admin/applications
Open the "Application Status" facet and select "Rejected"

Expected Test Results: Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

Action: Click on "View finished application" for one of the results

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the edit form for the application
The Quick Reject feature is not available

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Rejected" filter and select "Accepted" from the "Application Status" facet

Expected Test Results: Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

Action: Clear the "Accepted" filter and select any other status except "Rejected" from the "Application Status" facet

Expected Test Results: Every result includes the text "Review application" or "Review update" on the bottom right

Action: Click on "Review Application"

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the edit form for the application in a new tab
The Quick Reject feature is available

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Application Status" filter
Open the "Record type" facet and select "new application"

Expected Test Results: Every result includes the text "Review application" on the bottom right

Action: Clear the "new application" filter and select "update request" from the "Record type" facet

Expected Test Results: Every result includes the text "View journal being updated" and "Review update" at the bottom
The metadata for each record contains the field "Update Request For", and then an alphanumeric ID of a journal

Action: Click on the alphanumeric journal id

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the admin Journal search interface, and there is one result, which is the current journal for that update request

Action: Click back (as many times as needed) in your browser to return to the application search
Click on "view journal being updated" on the bottom right of one of your search results

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the Journal Form of the journal being updated

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Click on "Review update"

Expected Test Results: The update request review form is shown

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Record type" filter
Open the "Journal License" facet and select one of the CC licences

Expected Test Results: The "Journal Licence" metadata field in each search result has the appropriate CC icon displayed
